there be a very important batch of paper in preparation at that time. it have to travel from one end of simla to the other by hand.

the conversion of aurelian mcgoggin. 
ride with an idle whip ride with an unused heel. but once in a way there will come a day when the colt must be teach to feel the lash that fall and the curb that gall and the sting of the rowelled steel. life s handicap. 
this be not a tale exactly. it be a tract. and i be immensely proud of it. make a tract be a feat. 
every man be entitle to his own religious opinion. but no man least of all a junior ha a right to thrust these down other men s throat. the government send out weird civilian now and again. but mcgoggin be the queer export for a long time. he be clever brilliantly clever but his cleverness work the wrong way. instead of keep to the study of the vernacular he have read some book write by a man call comte i think and a man call spencer and a professor clifford. [you will find these book in the library. ] they deal with people s inside from the point of view of men who have no stomach. there be no order against his read them. but his mamma should have smack him. 
they ferment in his head and he come out to india with a rarefy religion over and above his work. it be not much of a creed. it only prove that men have no soul and there be no god and no hereafter and that you must worry along somehow for the good of humanity. 
one of it minor tenet seem to be that the one thing more sinful than give an order be obey it. at least that be what mcgoggin say. but i suspect he have misread his primer. 
i do not say a word against this creed. it be make up in town where there be nothing but machinery and asphalt and build all shut in by the fog. naturally a man grow to think that there be no one high than himself and that the metropolitan board of work make everything. but in this country where you really see humanity raw brown naked humanity with nothing between it and the blaze sky and only the use up over handle earth underfoot the notion somehow dy away and most folk come back to simple theory. life in india be not long enough to waste in prove that there be no one in particular at the head of affair. 
for this reason. the deputy be above the assistant the commissioner above the deputy the lieutenant governor above the commissioner and the viceroy above all four under the order of the secretary of state who be responsible to the empress. if the empress be not responsible to her maker if there be no maker for her to be responsible to the entire system of our administration must be wrong. which be manifestly impossible. at home men be to be excuse. they be stall up a good deal and get intellectually beany. when you take a gross beany horse to exercise he slaver and slobber over the bite till you can t see the horn. 
but the bite be there just the same. men do not get beany in india. the climate and the work be against play brick with word. 
if mcgoggin have keep his creed with the capital letter and the ending in ism to himself no one would have care. but his grandfather on both side have be wesleyan preacher and the preach strain come out in his mind. he want every one at the club to see that they have no soul too and to help him to eliminate his creator. a a good many men tell him he undoubtedly have no soul because he be so young but it do not follow that his senior be equally undeveloped. and whether there be another world or not a man still want to read his paper in this. but that be not the point that be not the point. aurelian use to say. then men throw sofa cushion at him and tell him to go to any particular place he might believe in. they christen him the blastoderm he say he come from a family of that name somewhere in the pre historic age and by insult and laughter strive to choke him dumb for he be an unmitigated nuisance at the club. besides be an offence to the old men. his deputy commissioner who be work on the frontier when aurelian be roll on a bed quilt tell him that for a clever boy aurelian be a very big idiot. and you know if he have go on with his work he would have be catch up to the secretariat in a few year. he be just the type that go there all head no physique and a hundred theory. not a soul be interest in mcgoggin s soul. he might have have two or none or somebody s else s. his business be to obey order and keep abreast of his file instead of devastate the club with ism. 
he work brilliantly. but he could not accept any order without try to good it. that be the fault of his creed. it make men too responsible and leave too much to their honor. you can sometimes ride an old horse in a halter. but never a colt. 
mcgoggin take more trouble over his case than any of the men of his year. he may have fancy that thirty page judgment on fifty rupee case both side perjure to the gullet advance the cause of humanity. at any rate he work too much and worry and fret over the rebuke he receive and lecture away on his ridiculous creed out of office till the doctor have to warn him that he be overdo it. no man can toil eighteen anna in the rupee in june without suffer. but mcgoggin be still intellectually beany and proud of himself and his power and he would take no hint. he work nine hour a day steadily. 
very well say the doctor you ll break down because you be over engined for your beam. mcgoggin be a little chap.

a a general rule it be inexpedient to meddle with question of state in a land where men be highly pay to work them out for you. 
this tale be a justifiable exception. 
once in every five year a you know we indent for a new viceroy. and each viceroy import with the rest of his baggage a private secretary who may or may not be the real viceroy just a fate ordain. fate look after the indian empire because it be so big and so helpless. 
there be a viceroy once who bring out with him a turbulent private secretary a hard man with a soft manner and a morbid passion for work. this secretary be call wonder john fennil wonder. the viceroy possess no name nothing but a string of county and two third of the alphabet after them. he say in confidence that he be the electro plat figurehead of a golden administration and he watch in a dreamy amuse way wonder s attempt to draw matter which be entirely outside his province into his own hand. when we be all cherubims together say his excellency once my dear good friend wonder will head the conspiracy for pluck out gabriel s tail feather or steal peter s key. then i shall report him. 
but though the viceroy do nothing to check wonder s officiousness other people say unpleasant thing. maybe the member of council begin it. but finally all simla agree that there be too much wonder and too little viceroy in that regime. wonder be always quote his excellency. it be his excellency this his excellency that in the opinion of his excellency and so on. the viceroy smile. but he do not heed. 
he say that so long a his old men squabble with his dear good wonder they might be induce to leave the immemorial east in peace. 
no wise man ha a policy say the viceroy. a policy be the blackmail levy on the fool by the unforeseen. i be not the former and i do not believe in the latter. 
i do not quite see what this mean unless it refer to an insurance policy. perhaps it be the viceroy s way of say. lie low. 
that season come up to simla one of these crazy people with only a single idea. these be the men who make thing move. but they be not nice to talk to. this man s name be mellish and he have live for fifteen year on land of his own in low bengal study cholera. he hold that cholera be a germ that propagate itself a it fly through a muggy atmosphere. and stick in the branch of tree like a wool flake. the germ could be render sterile he say by mellish s own invincible fumigatory a heavy violet black powder the result of fifteen year scientific investigation sir. 
inventor seem very much alike a a caste. they talk loudly especially about conspiracy of monopolist. they beat upon the table with their fist. and they secrete fragment of their invention about their person. 
mellish say that there be a medical ring at simla head by the surgeon general who be in league apparently with all the hospital assistant in the empire. i forget exactly how he prove it but it have something to do with skulk up to the hill. and what mellish want be the independent evidence of the viceroy steward of our most gracious majesty the queen sir. so mellish go up to simla with eighty four pound of fumigatory in his trunk to speak to the viceroy and to show him the merit of the invention. 
but it be easy to see a viceroy than to talk to him unless you chance to be a important a mellishe of madras. he be a six thousand rupee man so great that his daughter never marry. they contract alliance. he himself be not pay. he receive emolument and his journey about the country be tour of observation. his business be to stir up the people in madras with a long pole a you stir up stench in a pond and the people have to come up out of their comfortable old way and gasp. this be enlightenment and progress. isn t it fine. then they give mellishe statue and jasmine garland in the hope of get rid of him. 
mellishe come up to simla to confer with the viceroy. that be one of his perquisite. the viceroy know nothing of mellishe except that he be one of those middle class deity who seem necessary to the spiritual comfort of this paradise of the middle class and that in all probability he have suggest design found and endow all the public institution in madras. which prof that his excellency though dreamy have experience of the way of six thousand rupee men.

we be a high caste and enlighten race and infant marriage be very shock and the consequence be sometimes peculiar. but nevertheless the hindu notion which be the continental notion which be the aboriginal notion of arrange marriage irrespective of the personal inclination of the marry be sound. think for a minute and you will see that it must be so. unless of course you believe in affinity. in which case you have good not read this tale. how can a man who ha never marry. who cannot be trust to pick up at sight a moderately sound horse. whose head be hot and upset with vision of domestic felicity go about the choose of a wife. he cannot see straight or think straight if he try. and the same disadvantage exist in the case of a girl s fancy. but when mature marry and discreet people arrange a match between a boy and a girl they do it sensibly with a view to the future and the young couple live happily ever afterwards. a everybody know. 
properly speak government should establish a matrimonial department efficiently officer with a jury of matron a judge of the chief court a senior chaplain and an awful warn in the shape of a love match that ha go wrong chain to the tree in the courtyard. all marriage should be make through the department which might be subordinate to the educational department under the same penalty a that attach to the transfer of land without a stamp document. but government win t take suggestion. it pretend that it be too busy. however i will put my notion on record and explain the example that illustrate the theory. 
once upon a time there be a good young man a first class officer in his own department a man with a career before him and possibly a k. c. g. e. at the end of it. all his superior speak well of him because he know how to hold his tongue and his pen at the proper time. there be today only eleven men in india who posse this secret. and they have all with one exception attain great honor and enormous income. 
this good young man be quiet and self contain too old for his year by far. which always carry it own punishment. have a subaltern or a tea planter s assistant or anybody who enjoy life and ha no care for tomorrow do what he try to do not a soul would have care. but when peythroppe the estimable virtuous economical quiet hard work young peythroppe fell there be a flutter through five department. 
the manner of his fall be in this way. he meet a miss castries d castries it be originally but the family drop the d for administrative reason and he fell in love with her even more energetically than he work. understand clearly that there be not a breath of a word to be say against miss castries not a shadow of a breath. she be good and very lovely possess what innocent people at home call a spanish complexion with thick blue black hair grow low down on her forehead into a widow s peak and big violet eye under eyebrow a black and a straight a the border of a gazette extraordinary when a big man dy. but but but. well she be a very sweet girl and very pious but for many reason she be impossible. quite so. all good mamma know what impossible mean. it be obviously absurd that peythroppe should marry her. the little opal tint onyx at the base of her finger nail say this a plainly a print. further marriage with miss castries mean marriage with several other castries honorary lieutenant castries her papa mr. eulalie castries her mamma and all the ramification of the castries family on income range from r. to r. a month and their wife and connection again. 
it would have be cheap for peythroppe to have assault a commissioner with a dog whip or to have burn the record of a deputy commissioner s office than to have contract an alliance with the castries. it would have weight his after career le even under a government which never forget and never forgive. 
everybody saw this but peythroppe. he be go to marry miss castries he be be of age and draw a good income and woe betide the house that would not afterwards receive mr. virginie saulez peythroppe with the deference due to her husband s rank. 
that be peythroppe s ultimatum and any remonstrance drive him frantic. 
these sudden madness most afflict the sane men. there be a case once but i will tell you of that late on. you cannot account for the mania except under a theory directly contradict the one about the place wherein marriage be make. peythroppe be burningly anxious to put a millstone round his neck at the outset of his career and argument have not the least effect on him. he be go to marry miss castries and the business be his own business. 
he would thank you to keep your advice to yourself. with a man in this condition mere word only fix him in his purpose. of course he cannot see that marriage out here doe not concern the individual but the government he serf. 
do you remember mr. hauksbee the most wonderful woman in india. she save pluffles from mr. reiver win tarrion his appointment in the foreign office and be defeat in open field by mr. cusack bremmil. she hear of the lamentable condition of peythroppe and her brain strike out the plan that save him. she have the wisdom of the serpent the logical coherence of the man the fearlessness of the child and the triple intuition of the woman. never no never a long a a tonga bucket down the solon dip or the couple go a rid at the back of summer hill will there be such a genius a mr. hauksbee. she attend the consultation of three men on peythroppe s case. and she stand up with the lash of her rid whip between her lip and spake. 
three week late peythroppe din with the three men and the gazette of india come in. peythroppe find to his surprise that he have be gazette a month s leave. don t ask me how this be manage. i believe firmly that if mr. hauksbee give the order the whole great indian administration would stand on it head. 
the three men have also a month s leave each. peythroppe put the gazette down and say bad word. then there come from the compound the soft pad pad of camel thief camel the bikaneer breed that don t bubble and howl when they sit down and get up. 
after that i don t know what happen. this much be certain. 
peythroppe disappear vanish like smoke and the long foot rest chair in the house of the three men be break to splinter. also a bedstead depart from one of the bedroom. 
mr. hauksbee say that mr. peythroppe be shoot in rajputana with the three men. so we be compel to believe her. 
at the end of the month peythroppe be gazette twenty day extension of leave. but there be wrath and lamentation in the house of castries. the marriage day have be fix but the bridegroom never come. and the d silva pereiras and ducketts lift their voice and mock honorary lieutenant castries a one who have be basely impose upon. mr. hauksbee go to the wed and be much astonish when peythroppe do not appear. after seven week peythroppe and the three men return from rajputana. peythroppe be in hard tough condition rather white and more self contain than ever. 
one of the three men have a cut on his nose cause by the kick of a gun. twelve bore kick rather curiously. 
then come honorary lieutenant castries seek for the blood of his perfidious son in law to be. he say thing vulgar and impossible thing which show the raw rough ranker below the honorary and i fancy peythroppe s eye be open. anyhow he hold his peace till the end. when he speak briefly. honorary lieutenant castries ask for a peg before he go away to die or bring a suit for breach of promise. 
miss castries be a very good girl. she say that she would have no breach of promise suit. she say that if she be not a lady she be refine enough to know that lady keep their break heart to themselves. and a she rule her parent nothing happen. late on she marry a most respectable and gentlemanly person. he travel for an enterprising firm in calcutta and be all that a good husband should be. 
so peythroppe come to his right mind again and do much good work and be honor by all who know him. one of these day he will marry. but he will marry a sweet pink and white maiden on the government house list with a little money and some influential connection a every wise man should. and he will never all his life tell her what happen during the seven week of his shoot tour in rajputana. 
but just think how much trouble and expense for camel hire be not cheap and those bikaneer brute have to be feed like human might have be save by a properly conduct matrimonial department under the control of the director general of education but correspond direct with the viceroy.

the unedited autobiography of private ortheris. 
if there be one thing on which golightly pride himself more than another it be look like an officer and a gentleman. he say it be for the honor of the service that he attire himself so elaborately. but those who know him best say that it be just personal vanity. there be no harm about golightly not an ounce. 
he recognize a horse when he saw one and could do more than fill a cantle. he play a very fair game at billiards and be a sound man at the whist table. everyone like him. and nobody ever dream of see him handcuff on a station platform a a deserter. but this sad thing happen. 
he be go down from dalhousie at the end of his leave rid down. he have cut his leave a fine a he dare and want to come down in a hurry. 
it be fairly warm at dalhousie and know what to expect below he descend in a new khaki suit tight fit of a delicate olive green. a peacock blue tie white collar and a snowy white solah helmet. he pride himself on look neat even when he be rid post. he do look neat and he be so deeply concern about his appearance before he start that he quite forget to take anything but some small change with him. he leave all his note at the hotel. his servant have go down the road before him to be ready in wait at pathankote with a change of gear. that be what he call travel in light march order. he be proud of his faculty of organization what we call bundobust. 
twenty two mile out of dalhousie it begin to rain not a mere hill shower but a good tepid monsoonish downpour. golightly bustle on wish that he have bring an umbrella. the dust on the road turn into mud and the pony mire a good deal. so do golightly s khaki gaiter. but he keep on steadily and try to think how pleasant the coolth be. 
his next pony be rather a brute at start and golightly s hand be slippery with the rain contrive to get rid of golightly at a corner. he chase the animal catch it and go ahead briskly. 
the spill have not improve his clothe or his temper and he have lose one spur. he keep the other one employ. by the time that stage be end the pony have have a much exercise a he want and in spite of the rain golightly be sweat freely. at the end of another miserable half hour golightly find the world disappear before his eye in clammy pulp. the rain have turn the pith of his huge and snowy solah topee into an evil smell dough and it have close on his head like a half open mushroom. also the green line be begin to run. 
golightly do not say anything worth record here. he tear off and squeeze up a much of the brim a be in his eye and plough on. the back of the helmet be flap on his neck and the side stick to his ear but the leather band and green line keep thing roughly together so that the hat do not actually melt away where it flap. 
presently the pulp and the green stuff make a sort of slimy mildew which run over golightly in several direction down his back and bosom for choice. the khaki color run too it be really shockingly bad dye and section of golightly be brown and patch be violet and contour be ochre and streak be ruddy red and blotch be nearly white accord to the nature and peculiarity of the dye. when he take out his handkerchief to wipe his face and the green of the hat line and the purple stuff that have soak through on to his neck from the tie become thoroughly mix the effect be amaze. 
near dhar the rain stop and the even sun come out and dry him up slightly. it fix the color too. three mile from pathankote the last pony fell dead lame and golightly be force to walk. he push on into pathankote to find his servant. he do not know then that his khitmatgar have stop by the roadside to get drink and would come on the next day say that he have sprain his ankle. when he get into pathankote he couldn t find his servant his boot be stiff and ropy with mud and there be large quantity of dirt about his body. the blue tie have run a much a the khaki. so he take it off with the collar and throw it away. then he say something about servant generally and try to get a peg. he pay eight anna for the drink and this reveal to him that he have only six anna more in his pocket or in the world a he stand at that hour. 
he go to the station master to negotiate for a first class ticket to khasa where he be station. the book clerk say something to the station master the station master say something to the telegraph clerk and the three look at him with curiosity. they ask him to wait for half an hour while they telegraph to umritsar for authority. so he wait and four constable come and group themselves picturesquely round him. just a he be prepare to ask them to go away the station master say that he would give the sahib a ticket to umritsar if the sahib would kindly come inside the book office. golightly step inside and the next thing he know be that a constable be attach to each of his leg and arm while the station master be try to cram a mailbag over his head. 
there be a very fair scuffle all round the book office and golightly receive a nasty cut over his eye through fall against a table. but the constable be too much for him and they and the station master handcuff him securely. a soon a the mail bag be slip he begin express his opinion and the head constable say. without doubt this be the soldier englishman we require. listen to the abuse. then golightly ask the station master what the this and the that the proceeding mean. the station master tell him he be private john binkle of the regiment ft. in. fair hair gray eye and a dissipate appearance no mark on the body who have desert a fortnight ago. golightly begin explain at great length. and the more he explain the le the station master believe him. he say that no lieutenant could look such a ruffian a do golightly and that his instruction be to send his capture under proper escort to umritsar. golightly be feel very damp and uncomfortable and the language he use be not fit for publication even in an expurgate form. the four constable saw him safe to umritsar in an intermediate compartment and he spend the four hour journey in abuse them a fluently a his knowledge of the vernacular allow. 
at umritsar he be bundle out on the platform into the arm of a corporal and two men of the regiment. golightly draw himself up and try to carry off matter jauntily. he do not feel too jaunty in handcuff with four constable behind him and the blood from the cut on his forehead stiffen on his leave cheek. the corporal be not jocular either. golightly get a far a this be a very absurd mistake my men when the corporal tell him to stow his lip and come along. golightly do not want to come along. he desire to stop and explain. he explain very well indeed until the corporal cut in with. you a orficer. it s the like o you a bring disgrace on the like of u. bloom in fine orficer you be. i know your regiment. the rogue s march be the quickstep where you come from. you re a black shame to the service. 
golightly keep his temper and begin explain all over again from the begin. then he be march out of the rain into the refreshment room and tell not to make a qualify fool of himself. 
the men be go to run him up to fort govindghar. and run up be a performance almost a undignified a the frog march. 
golightly be nearly hysterical with rage and the chill and the mistake and the handcuff and the headache that the cut on his forehead have give him. he really lay himself out to express what be in his mind. when he have quite finish and his throat be feel dry one of the men say. i ve eard a few beggar in the click blind stiff and crack on a bite. but i ve never eard any one to touch this ere orficer. they be not angry with him. they rather admire him. they have some beer at the refreshment room and offer golightly some too because he have swear win erful. they ask him to tell them all about the adventure of private john binkle while he be loose on the countryside. and that make golightly wild than ever. if he have keep his wit about him he would have keep quiet until an officer come. but he attempt to run. 
now the butt of a martini in the small of your back hurt a great deal and rotten rain soak khaki tear easily when two men be jerk at your collar. 
golightly rise from the floor feel very sick and giddy with his shirt rip open all down his breast and nearly all down his back. 
he yield to his luck and at that point the down train from lahore come in carry one of golightly s major. 
this be the major s evidence in full. 
there be the sound of a scuffle in the second class refreshment room so i go in and saw the most villainous loafer that i ever set eye on. his boot and breech be plaster with mud and beer stain. he wear a muddy white dunghill sort of thing on his head and it hang down in slip on his shoulder which be a good deal scratch. he be half in and half out of a shirt a nearly in two piece a it could be and he be beg the guard to look at the name on the tail of it. a he have ruck the shirt all over his head i couldn t at first see who he be but i fancy that he be a man in the first stage of d. t. from the way he swear while he wrestle with his rag. when he turn round and i have make allowance for a lump a big a a pork pie over one eye and some green war paint on the face and some violet stripe round the neck i saw that it be golightly. he be very glad to see me say the major and he hop i would not tell the mess about it. i didn t but you can if you like now that golightly ha go home. 
golightly spend the great part of that summer in try to get the corporal and the two soldier try by court martial for arrest an officer and a gentleman. they be of course very sorry for their error. but the tale leak into the regimental canteen and thence run about the province. 
the house of suddhoo. 
a stone s throw out on either hand from that well order road we tread and all the world be wild and strange. churel and ghoul and djinn and sprite shall bear u company tonight for we have reach the old land wherein the power of darkness range. from the dusk to the dawn. 
the house of suddhoo near the taksali gate be two storied with four carve window of old brown wood and a flat roof. you may recognize it by five red hand print arrange like the five of diamond on the whitewash between the upper window. bhagwan das the bunnia and a man who say he get his live by seal cut live in the low story with a troop of wife servant friend and retainer. the two upper room use to be occupy by janoo and azizun and a little black and tan terrier that be steal from an englishman s house and give to janoo by a soldier. today only janoo life in the upper room. suddhoo sleep on the roof generally except when he sleep in the street. he use to go to peshawar in the cold weather to visit his son who sell curiosity near the edwardes gate and then he sleep under a real mud roof. 
suddhoo be a great friend of mine because his cousin have a son who secure thank to my recommendation the post of head messenger to a big firm in the station. suddhoo say that god will make me a lieutenant governor one of these day. i daresay his prophecy will come true. he be very very old with white hair and no teeth worth show and he ha outlive his wit outlive nearly everything except his fondness for his son at peshawar. janoo and azizun be kashmiri lady of the city and theirs be an ancient and more or le honorable profession. but azizun ha since marry a medical student from the north west and ha settle down to a most respectable life somewhere near bareilly. bhagwan das be an extortionate and an adulterator. he be very rich. the man who be suppose to get his live by seal cut pretend to be very poor. 
this let you know a much a be necessary of the four principal tenant in the house of suddhoo. then there be me of course. but i be only the chorus that come in at the end to explain thing. so i do not count. 
suddhoo be not clever. the man who pretend to cut seal be the clever of them all bhagwan das only know how to lie except janoo. she be also beautiful but that be her own affair. 
suddhoo s son at peshawar be attack by pleurisy and old suddhoo be trouble. the seal cutter man hear of suddhoo s anxiety and make capital out of it. he be abreast of the time. he get a friend in peshawar to telegraph daily account of the son s health. 
and here the story begin. 
suddhoo s cousin s son tell me one even that suddhoo want to see me. that he be too old and feeble to come personally and that i should be confer an everlasting honor on the house of suddhoo if i go to him. i go. but i think see how well off suddhoo be then that he might have send something good than an ekka which jolt fearfully to haul out a future lieutenant governor to the city on a muggy april even. the ekka do not run quickly. 
it be full dark when we pull up opposite the door of ranjit singh s tomb near the main gate of the fort. here be suddhoo and he say that by reason of my condescension it be absolutely certain that i should become a lieutenant governor while my hair be yet black. then we talk about the weather and the state of my health and the wheat crop for fifteen minute in the huzuri bagh under the star. 
suddhoo come to the point at last. he say that janoo have tell him that there be an order of the sirkar against magic because it be fear that magic might one day kill the empress of india. i didn t know anything about the state of the law. but i fancy that something interest be go to happen. i say that so far from magic be discourage by the government it be highly commend. 
the great official of the state practice it themselves. if the financial statement isn t magic i don t know what be. then to encourage him further i say that if there be any jadoo afoot i have not the least objection to give it my countenance and sanction and to see that it be clean jadoo white magic a distinguish from the unclean jadoo which kill folk. it take a long time before suddhoo admit that this be just what he have ask me to come for. then he tell me in jerk and quaver that the man who say he cut seal be a sorcerer of the clean kind. that every day he give suddhoo news of the sick son in peshawar more quickly than the lightning could fly and that this news be always corroborate by the letter. further that he have tell suddhoo how a great danger be threaten his son which could be remove by clean jadoo. and of course heavy payment. i begin to see how the land lay and tell suddhoo that i also understand a little jadoo in the western line and would go to his house to see that everything be do decently and in order. we set off together. and on the way suddhoo tell me he have pay the seal cutter between one hundred and two hundred rupee already. and the jadoo of that night would cost two hundred more. which be cheap he say consider the greatness of his son s danger. but i do not think he mean it. 
the light be all cloak in the front of the house when we arrive. i could hear awful noise from behind the seal cutter s shop front a if some one be groan his soul out. suddhoo shake all over and while we grope our way upstairs tell me that the jadoo have begin. janoo and azizun meet u at the stair head and tell u that the jadoo work be come off in their room because there be more space there. janoo be a lady of a freethinking turn of mind. she whisper that the jadoo be an invention to get money out of suddhoo and that the seal cutter would go to a hot place when he die. suddhoo be nearly cry with fear and old age. he keep walk up and down the room in the half light repeat his son s name over and over again and ask azizun if the seal cutter ought not to make a reduction in the case of his own landlord. 
janoo pull me over to the shadow in the recess of the carve bow window. the board be up and the room be only light by one tiny lamp. there be no chance of my be see if i stay still. 
presently the groan below cease and we hear step on the staircase. that be the seal cutter. he stop outside the door a the terrier bark and azizun fumble at the chain and he tell suddhoo to blow out the lamp. this leave the place in jet darkness except for the red glow from the two huqas that belong to janoo and azizun. the seal cutter come in and i hear suddhoo throw himself down on the floor and groan. azizun catch her breath and janoo back to one of the bed with a shudder. there be a clink of something metallic and then shoot up a pale blue green flame near the grind. the light be just enough to show azizun press against one corner of the room with the terrier between her knee. janoo with her hand clasp lean forward a she sit on the bed. suddhoo face down quiver and the seal cutter. 
i hope i may never see another man like that seal cutter. he be strip to the waist with a wreath of white jasmine a thick a my wrist round his forehead a salmon color loin cloth round his middle and a steel bangle on each ankle. this be not awe inspire. it be the face of the man that turn me cold. it be blue gray in the first place. in the second the eye be roll back till you could only see the white of them. and in the third the face be the face of a demon a ghoul anything you please except of the sleek oily old ruffian who sit in the day time over his turn lathe downstairs. he be lie on his stomach with his arm turn and cross behind him a if he have be throw down pinion. his head and neck be the only part of him off the floor. they be nearly at right angle to the body like the head of a cobra at spring. it be ghastly. in the centre of the room on the bare earth floor stand a big deep brass basin with a pale blue green light float in the centre like a night light. round that basin the man on the floor wriggle himself three time. how he do it i do not know. i could see the muscle ripple along his spine and fall smooth again. but i could not see any other motion. 
the head seem the only thing alive about him except that slow curl and uncurl of the labor back muscle. janoo from the bed be breathe seventy to the minute. azizun hold her hand before her eye. and old suddhoo finger at the dirt that have get into his white beard be cry to himself. the horror of it be that the creep crawly thing make no sound only crawl. and remember this last for ten minute while the terrier whine and azizun shudder and janoo gasp and suddhoo cry. 
i felt the hair lift at the back of my head and my heart thump like a thermantidote paddle. luckily the seal cutter betray himself by his most impressive trick and make me calm again. after he have finish that unspeakable triple crawl he stretch his head away from the floor a high a he could and send out a jet of fire from his nostril. now i know how fire spout be do i can do it myself so i felt at ease. the business be a fraud. if he have only keep to that crawl without try to raise the effect goodness know what i might not have think. both the girl shriek at the jet of fire and the head drop chin down on the floor with a thud. the whole body lie then like a corpse with it arm truss. 
there be a pause of five full minute after this and the blue green flame die down. janoo stoop to settle one of her anklet while azizun turn her face to the wall and take the terrier in her arm. suddhoo put out an arm mechanically to janoo s huqa and she slide it across the floor with her foot. directly above the body and on the wall be a couple of flame portrait in stamp paper frame of the queen and the prince of wale. they look down on the performance and to my think seem to heighten the grotesqueness of it all. 
just when the silence be get unendurable the body turn over and roll away from the basin to the side of the room where it lay stomach up. there be a faint plop from the basin exactly like the noise a fish make when it take a fly and the green light in the centre revive. 
i look at the basin and saw bob in the water the dry shrivel black head of a native baby open eye open mouth and shave scalp. it be bad be so very sudden than the crawl exhibition. we have no time to say anything before it begin to speak. 
read poe s account of the voice that come from the mesmerize die man and you will realize le than one half of the horror of that head s voice. 
there be an interval of a second or two between each word and a sort of ring ring ring in the note of the voice like the timbre of a bell. it peal slowly a if talk to itself for several minute before i get rid of my cold sweat. then the bless solution strike me. i look at the body lie near the doorway and saw just where the hollow of the throat join on the shoulder a muscle that have nothing to do with any man s regular breathe twitch away steadily. the whole thing be a careful reproduction of the egyptian teraphin that one read about sometimes and the voice be a clever and a appal a piece of ventriloquism a one could wish to hear. all this time the head be lip lip lap against the side of the basin and speak. it tell suddhoo on his face again whine of his son s illness and of the state of the illness up to the even of that very night. i always shall respect the seal cutter for keep so faithfully to the time of the peshawar telegram. it go on to say that skilled doctor be night and day watch over the man s life. and that he would eventually recover if the fee to the potent sorcerer whose servant be the head in the basin be double. 
here the mistake from the artistic point of view come in. to ask for twice your stipulate fee in a voice that lazarus might have use when he rise from the dead be absurd. janoo who be really a woman of masculine intellect saw this a quickly a i do. i hear her say asli nahin. fareib. scornfully under her breath. and just a she say so the light in the basin die out the head stop talk and we hear the room door creak on it hinge. then janoo strike a match light the lamp and we saw that head basin and seal cutter be go. suddhoo be wring his hand and explain to any one who care to listen that if his chance of eternal salvation depend on it he could not raise another two hundred rupee. azizun be nearly in hysteric in the corner. while janoo sit down composedly on one of the bed to discus the probability of the whole thing be a bunao or make up. 
i explain a much a i know of the seal cutter s way of jadoo. but her argument be much more simple. the magic that be always demand gift be no true magic say she. my mother tell me that the only potent love spell be those which be tell you for love. this seal cutter man be a liar and a devil. i dare not tell do anything or get anything do because i be in debt to bhagwan das the bunnia for two gold ring and a heavy anklet. i must get my food from his shop. the seal cutter be the friend of bhagwan das and he would poison my food. a fool s jadoo ha be go on for ten day and ha cost suddhoo many rupee each night. the seal cutter use black hen and lemon and mantra before. he never show u anything like this till tonight. azizun be a fool and will be a purdah nashin soon. suddhoo ha lose his strength and his wit. see now. i have hop to get from suddhoo many rupee while he live and many more after his death. and behold he be spend everything on that offspring of a devil and a she as the seal cutter. 
here i say. but what induce suddhoo to drag me into the business. of course i can speak to the seal cutter and he shall refund. the whole thing be child s talk shame and senseless. 
suddhoo be an old child say janoo. he ha live on the roof these seventy year and be a senseless a a milch goat. he bring you here to assure himself that he be not break any law of the sirkar whose salt he eat many year ago. he worship the dust off the foot of the seal cutter and that cow devourer ha forbid him to go and see his son. what doe suddhoo know of your law or the lightning post. i have to watch his money go day by day to that lie beast below. 
janoo stamp her foot on the floor and nearly cry with vexation. while suddhoo be whimper under a blanket in the corner and azizun be try to guide the pipe stem to his foolish old mouth. 
now the case stand thus. unthinkingly i have lay myself open to the charge of aid and abet the seal cutter in obtain money under false pretence which be forbid by section of the indian penal code. i be helpless in the matter for these reason i cannot inform the police. what witness would support my statement. janoo refuse flatly azizun be a veil woman somewhere near bareilly lose in this big india of ours. i cannot again take the law into my own hand and speak to the seal cutter. for certain be i that not only would suddhoo disbelieve me but this step would end in the poison of janoo who be bind hand and foot by her debt to the bunnia. suddhoo be an old dotard. and whenever we meet mumble my idiotic joke that the sirkar rather patronize the black art than otherwise. his son be well now. but suddhoo be completely under the influence of the seal cutter by whose advice he regulate the affair of his life. janoo watch daily the money that she hop to wheedle out of suddhoo take by the seal cutter and become daily more furious and sullen. 
she will never tell because she dare not. but unless something happen to prevent her i be afraid that the seal cutter will die of cholera the white arsenic kind about the middle of may. and thus i shall have to be privy to a murder in the house of suddhoo. 
his wed wife. 
cry murder. in the market place and each will turn upon his neighbor anxious eye that ask. art thou the man. we hunt cain some century ago across the world that breed the fear our own misdeed maintain today. vibart s morality. 
shakespeare say something about worm or it may be giant or beetle turn if you tread on them too severely. the safe plan be never to tread on a worm not even on the last new subaltern from home with his button hardly out of their tissue paper and the red of sappy english beef in his cheek. this be the story of the worm that turn. for the sake of brevity we will call henry augustus ramsay faizanne the worm although he really be an exceedingly pretty boy without a hair on his face and with a waist like a girl s when he come out to the second shikarris and be make unhappy in several way. the shikarris be a high caste regiment and you must be able to do thing well play a banjo or ride more than a little or sing or act to get on with them. 
the worm do nothing except fall off his pony and knock chip out of gate post with his trap. even that become monotonous after a time. he object to whist cut the cloth at billiards sing out of tune keep very much to himself and write to his mamma and sister at home. four of these five thing be vice which the shikarris object to and set themselves to eradicate. every one know how subaltern be by brother subaltern soften and not permit to be ferocious. it be good and wholesome and doe no one any harm unless temper be lose. and then there be trouble. there be a man once but that be another story. 
the shikarris shikarred the worm very much and he bore everything without wink. he be so good and so anxious to learn and flush so pink that his education be cut short and he be leave to his own device by every one except the senior subaltern who continue to make life a burden to the worm. the senior subaltern mean no harm. but his chaff be coarse and he didn t quite understand where to stop. he have be wait too long for his company. and that always sour a man. also he be in love which make him bad. 
one day after he have borrow the worm s trap for a lady who never exist have use it himself all the afternoon have send a note to the worm purport to come from the lady and be tell the mess all about it the worm rise in his place and say in his quiet ladylike voice. that be a very pretty sell. but i ll lay you a month s pay to a month s pay when you get your step that i work a sell on you that you ll remember for the rest of your day and the regiment after you when you re dead or break. the worm wasn t angry in the least and the rest of the mess shout. then the senior subaltern look at the worm from the boot upwards and down again and say do baby. the worm take the rest of the mess to witness that the bet have be take and retire into a book with a sweet smile. 
two month pass and the senior subaltern still educate the worm who begin to move about a little more a the hot weather come on. i have say that the senior subaltern be in love. the curious thing be that a girl be in love with the senior subaltern. though the colonel say awful thing and the major snort and marry captain look unutterable wisdom and the junior scoff those two be engage. 
the senior subaltern be so please with get his company and his acceptance at the same time that he forget to bother the worm. the girl be a pretty girl and have money of her own. she doe not come into this story at all. 
one night at the begin of the hot weather all the mess except the worm who have go to his own room to write home letter be sit on the platform outside the mess house. the band have finish play but no one want to go in. and the captain wife be there also. the folly of a man in love be unlimited. 
the senior subaltern have be hold forth on the merit of the girl he be engage to and the lady be purr approval while the men yawn when there be a rustle of skirt in the dark and a tire faint voice lift itself. 
where s my husband. 
i do not wish in the least to reflect on the morality of the shikarris. but it be on record that four men jump up a if they have be shoot. three of them be marry men. perhaps they be afraid that their wife have come from home unbeknownst. the fourth say that he have act on the impulse of the moment. he explain this afterwards. 
then the voice cry. oh lionel. lionel be the senior subaltern s name. a woman come into the little circle of light by the candle on the peg table stretch out her hand to the dark where the senior subaltern be and sob. we rise to our foot feel that thing be go to happen and ready to believe the bad. in this bad small world of ours one know so little of the life of the next man which after all be entirely his own concern that one be not surprise when a crash come. anything might turn up any day for any one. perhaps the senior subaltern have be trap in his youth. men be cripple that way occasionally. we didn t know. we want to hear. and the captain wife be a anxious a we. if he have be trap he be to be excuse. for the woman from nowhere in the dusty shoe and gray travel dress be very lovely with black hair and great eye full of tear. she be tall with a fine figure and her voice have a run sob in it pitiful to hear. a soon a the senior subaltern stand up she throw her arm round his neck and call him my darling and say she could not bear wait alone in england and his letter be so short and cold and she be his to the end of the world and would he forgive her. this do not sound quite like a lady s way of speak. it be too demonstrative. 
thing seem black indeed and the captain wife peer under their eyebrow at the senior subaltern and the colonel s face set like the day of judgment frame in gray bristle and no one speak for a while. 
next the colonel say very shortly. well sir. and the woman sob afresh. the senior subaltern be half choke with the arm round his neck but he gasp out. it s a d d lie. i never have a wife in my life. don t swear say the colonel. come into the mess. we must sift this clear somehow and he sigh to himself for he believe in his shikarris do the colonel. 
we troop into the ante room under the full light and there we saw how beautiful the woman be. she stand up in the middle of u all sometimes choke with cry then hard and proud and then hold out her arm to the senior subaltern. it be like the fourth act of a tragedy. she tell u how the senior subaltern have marry her when he be home on leave eighteen month before. and she seem to know all that we know and more too of his people and his past life. he be white and ashy gray try now and again to break into the torrent of her word. and we note how lovely she be and what a criminal he look esteem him a beast of the bad kind. we felt sorry for him though. 
i shall never forget the indictment of the senior subaltern by his wife. nor will he. it be so sudden rush out of the dark unannounced into our dull life. the captain wife stand back. but their eye be alight and you could see that they have already convict and sentence the senior subaltern. the colonel seem five year old. one major be shade his eye with his hand and watch the woman from underneath it. another be chew his moustache and smile quietly a if he be witness a play. full in the open space in the centre by the whist table the senior subaltern s terrier be hunt for flea. i remember all this a clearly a though a photograph be in my hand. i remember the look of horror on the senior subaltern s face. it be rather like see a man hang. but much more interest. finally the woman wind up by say that the senior subaltern carry a double f. m. in tattoo on his leave shoulder. we all know that and to our innocent mind it seem to clinch the matter. but one of the bachelor major say very politely. i presume that your marriage certificate would be more to the purpose. 
that rouse the woman. she stand up and sneer at the senior subaltern for a cur and abuse the major and the colonel and all the rest. then she weep and then she pull a paper from her breast say imperially. take that. and let my husband my lawfully wed husband read it aloud if he dare. 
there be a hush and the men look into each other s eye a the senior subaltern come forward in a daze and dizzy way and take the paper. we be wonder a we star whether there be anything against any one of u that might turn up late on. the senior subaltern s throat be dry. but a he run his eye over the paper he break out into a hoarse cackle of relief and say to the woman. you young blackguard. 
but the woman have flee through a door and on the paper be write. this be to certify that i the worm have pay in full my debt to the senior subaltern and further that the senior subaltern be my debtor by agreement on the d of february a by the mess attest to the extent of one month s captain s pay in the lawful currency of the india empire. then a deputation set off for the worm s quarter and find him betwixt and between unlace his stay with the hat wig serge dress etc. on the bed. he come over a he be and the shikarris shout till the gunner mess send over to know if they might have a share of the fun. i think we be all except the colonel and the senior subaltern a little disappoint that the scandal have come to nothing. but that be human nature. there could be no two word about the worm s act. it lean a near to a nasty tragedy a anything this side of a joke can. when most of the subaltern sit upon him with sofa cushion to find out why he have not say that act be his strong point he answer very quietly. i don t think you ever ask me. i use to act at home with my sister. but no act with girl could account for the worm s display that night. personally i think it be in bad taste. 
besides be dangerous. there be no sort of use in play with fire even for fun. 
the shikarris make him president of the regimental dramatic club. and when the senior subaltern pay up his debt which he do at once the worm sink the money in scenery and dress. he be a good worm. and the shikarris be proud of him. the only drawback be that he ha be christen mr. senior subaltern. and a there be now two mr. senior subaltern in the station this be sometimes confuse to stranger. 
late on i will tell you of a case something like this but with all the jest leave out and nothing in it but real trouble.
