there be more way of run a horse to suit your book than pull his head off in the straight. some men forget this. 
understand clearly that all race be rotten a everything connect with lose money must be. out here in addition to it inherent rottenness it ha the merit of be two third sham. look pretty on paper only. every one know every one else far too well for business purpose. how on earth can you rack and harry and post a man for his lose when you be fond of his wife and live in the same station with him. he say on the monday follow i can t settle just yet. you say all right old man and think your self lucky if you pull off nine hundred out of a two thousand rupee debt. any way you look at it indian race be immoral and expensively immoral. which be much bad. if a man want your money he ought to ask for it or send round a subscription list instead of juggle about the country with an australian larrikin. a brumby with a much breed a the boy. a brace of chumars in gold lace cap. three or four ekka pony with hog mane and a switch tail demirep of a mare call arab because she ha a kink in her flag. race lead to the shroff quick than anything else. but if you have no conscience and no sentiment and good hand and some knowledge of pace and ten year experience of horse and several thousand rupee a month i believe that you can occasionally contrive to pay your shoe bill. 
do you ever know shackle b. w. g. coarse loose mule like ear barrel a long a a gate post tough a a telegraph wire and the queer brute that ever look through a bridle. he be of no brand be one of an ear nick mob take into the bucephalus at l. s. a head to make up freight and sell raw and out of condition at calcutta for r. people who lose money on him call him a brumby. but if ever any horse have harpoon s shoulder and the gin s temper shackle be that horse. two mile be his own particular distance. he train himself run himself and ride himself. and if his jockey insult him by give him hint he shut up at once and buck the boy off. he object to dictation. two or three of his owner do not understand this and lose money in consequence. at last he be buy by a man who discover that if a race be to be win shackle and shackle only would win it in his own way so long a his jockey sit still. 
this man have a rid boy call brunt a lad from perth west australia and he teach brunt with a trainer s whip the hard thing a jock can learn to sit still to sit still and to keep on sit still. when brunt fairly grasp this truth shackle devastate the country. no weight could stop him at his own distance. and the fame of shackle spread from ajmir in the south to chedputter in the north. there be no horse like shackle so long a he be allow to do his work in his own way. but he be beat in the end. and the story of his fall be enough to make angel weep. 
at the low end of the chedputter racecourse just before the turn into the straight the track pass close to a couple of old brick mound enclose a funnel shape hollow. the big end of the funnel be not six foot from the railing on the off side. the astound peculiarity of the course be that if you stand at one particular place about half a mile away inside the course and speak at an ordinary pitch your voice just hit the funnel of the brick mound and make a curious whine echo there. a man discover this one morning by accident while out train with a friend. he mark the place to stand and speak from with a couple of brick and he keep his knowledge to himself. every peculiarity of a course be worth remember in a country where rat play the mischief with the elephant litter and steward build jump to suit their own stable. 
this man run a very fairish country breed a long rack high mare with the temper of a fiend and the pace of an airy wander seraph a drifty glidy stretch. the mare be a a delicate tribute to mr. reiver call the lady regula baddun or for short regula baddun. 
shackle jockey brunt be a quiet well behave boy but his nerve have be shake. he begin his career by rid jump race in melbourne where a few steward want lynch and be one of the jockey who come through the awful butchery perhaps you will recollect it of the maribyrnong plate. the wall be colonial rampart log of jarrak spike into masonry with wing a strong a church buttress. once in his stride a horse have to jump or fall. he couldn t run out. in the maribyrnong plate twelve horse be jam at the second wall. red hat lead fell this side and throw out the glen and the ruck come up behind and the space between wing and wing be one struggle scream kick shamble. four jockey be take out dead. three be very badly hurt and brunt be among the three. he tell the story of the maribyrnong plate sometimes. and when he describe how whalley on red hat say a the mare fell under him. god ha mercy i m do for. and how next instant sithee there and white otter have crush the life out of poor whalley and the dust hide a small hell of men and horse no one marvel that brunt have drop jump race and australia together. regula baddun s owner know that story by heart. brunt never vary it in the tell. he have no education. 
shackle come to the chedputter autumn race one year and his owner walk about insult the sportsman of chedputter generally till they go to the honorary secretary in a body and say. appoint handicapper and arrange a race which shall break shackle and humble the pride of his owner. the district rise against shackle and send up of their best. ousel who be suppose to be able to do his mile in. petard the stud breed train by a cavalry regiment who know how to train. gringalet the ewe lamb of the th. bobolink the pride of peshawar. and many others. 
they call that race the break link handicap because it be to smash shackle. and the handicapper pile on the weight and the fund give eight hundred rupee and the distance be round the course for all horse. shackle owner say. you can arrange the race with regard to shackle only. so long a you don t bury him under weight cloth i don t mind. regula baddun s owner say. i throw in my mare to fret ousel. six furlong be regula s distance and she will then lie down and die. so also will ousel for his jockey doesn t understand a wait race. now this be a lie for regula have be in work for two month at dehra and her chance be good always suppose that shackle break a blood vessel or brunt move on him. 
the plunge in the lottery be fine. they fill eight thousand rupee lottery on the break link handicap and the account in the pioneer say that favoritism be divide. in plain english the various contingent be wild on their respective horse. for the handicapper have do their work well. the honorary secretary shout himself hoarse through the din. and the smoke of the cheroot be like the smoke and the rattle of the dice box like the rattle of small arm fire. 
ten horse start very level and regula baddun s owner canter out on his back to a place inside the circle of the course where two brick have be throw. he face towards the brick mound at the low end of the course and wait. 
the story of the run be in the pioneer. at the end of the first mile shackle creep out of the ruck well on the outside ready to get round the turn lay hold of the bite and spin up the straight before the others know he have get away. brunt be sit still perfectly happy listen to the drum drum drum of the hoof behind and know that in about twenty stride shackle would draw one deep breath and go up the last half mile like the fly dutchman. a shackle go short to take the turn and come abreast of the brick mound brunt hear above the noise of the wind in his ear a whine wail voice on the offside say. god ha mercy i m do for. in one stride brunt saw the whole seethe smash of the maribyrnong plate before him start in his saddle and give a yell of terror. the start bring the heel into shackle side and the scream hurt shackle feeling. he couldn t stop dead. but he put out his foot and slide along for fifty yard and then very gravely and judicially buck off brunt a shake terror stricken lump while regula baddun make a neck and neck race with bobolink up the straight and win by a short head petard a bad third. shackle owner in the stand try to think that his field glass have go wrong. regula baddun s owner wait by the two brick give one deep sigh of relief and canter back to the stand. he have win in lottery and bet about fifteen thousand. 
it be a break link handicap with a vengeance. it break nearly all the men concern and nearly break the heart of shackle owner. 
he go down to interview brunt. the boy lay livid and gasp with fright where he have tumble off. the sin of lose the race never seem to strike him. all he know be that whalley have call him that the call be a warn. and be he cut in two for it he would never get up again. his nerve have go altogether and he only ask his master to give him a good thrash and let him go. he be fit for nothing he say. he get his dismissal and creep up to the paddock white a chalk with blue lip his knee give way under him. people say nasty thing in the paddock. but brunt never heed. he change into tweed take his stick and go down the road still shake with fright and mutter over and over again. god ha mercy i m do for. to the best of my knowledge and belief he speak the truth. 
so now you know how the break link handicap be run and win. of course you don t believe it. you would credit anything about russia s design on india or the recommendation of the currency commission. but a little bite of sober fact be more than you can stand. 
beyond the pale. 
love heed not caste nor sleep a break bed. i go in search of love and lose myself. hindu proverb. 
a man should whatever happen keep to his own caste race and breed. let the white go to the white and the black to the black. 
then whatever trouble fall be in the ordinary course of thing neither sudden alien nor unexpected. 
this be the story of a man who wilfully step beyond the safe limit of decent every day society and pay for it heavily. 
he know too much in the first instance. and he saw too much in the second. he take too deep an interest in native life. but he will never do so again. 
deep away in the heart of the city behind jitha megji s bustee lie amir nath s gully which end in a dead wall pierce by one grate window. at the head of the gully be a big cow byre and the wall on either side of the gully be without window. neither suchet singh nor gaur chand approve of their woman folk look into the world. if durga charan have be of their opinion he would have be a happy man today and little bisesa would have be able to knead her own bread. her room look out through the grate window into the narrow dark gully where the sun never come and where the buffalo wallow in the blue slime. she be a widow about fifteen year old and she pray the god day and night to send her a lover. for she do not approve of live alone. 
one day the man trejago his name be come into amir nath s gully on an aimless wander. and after he have pass the buffalo stumble over a big heap of cattle food. 
then he saw that the gully end in a trap and hear a little laugh from behind the grate window. it be a pretty little laugh and trejago know that for all practical purpose the old arabian night be good guide go forward to the window and whisper that verse of the love song of har dyal which begin. 
can a man stand upright in the face of the naked sun. or a lover in the presence of his beloved. if my foot fail me o heart of my heart be i to blame be blind by the glimpse of your beauty. 
there come the faint tchinks of a woman s bracelet from behind the grate and a little voice go on with the song at the fifth verse. 
ala. ala. can the moon tell the lotus of her love when the gate of heaven be shut and the cloud gather for the rain. they have take my beloved and drive her with the pack horse to the north. there be iron chain on the foot that be set on my heart. call to the bowman to make ready. 
the voice stop suddenly and trejago walk out of amir nath s gully wonder who in the world could have cap the love song of har dyal so neatly. 
next morning a he be drive to the office an old woman throw a packet into his dog cart. in the packet be the half of a break glass bangle one flower of the blood red dhak a pinch of bhusa or cattle food and eleven cardamom. that packet be a letter not a clumsy compromise letter but an innocent unintelligible lover s epistle. 
trejago know far too much about these thing a i have say. no englishman should be able to translate object letter. but trejago spread all the trifle on the lid of his office box and begin to puzzle them out. 
a break glass bangle stand for a hindu widow all india over. because when her husband dy a woman s bracelet be break on her wrist. trejago saw the mean of the little bite of the glass. 
the flower of the dhak mean diversely desire come write or danger accord to the other thing with it. one cardamom mean jealousy. but when any article be duplicate in an object letter it lose it symbolic mean and stand merely for one of a number indicate time or if incense curd or saffron be send also place. the message run then. a widow dhak flower and bhusa at eleven o clock. the pinch of bhusa enlighten trejago. he saw this kind of letter leaf much to instinctive knowledge that the bhusa refer to the big heap of cattle food over which he have fall in amir nath s gully and that the message must come from the person behind the grate. she be a widow. so the message run then. a widow in the gully in which be the heap of bhusa desire you to come at eleven o clock. 
trejago throw all the rubbish into the fireplace and laugh. he know that men in the east do not make love under window at eleven in the forenoon nor do woman fix appointment a week in advance. 
so he go that very night at eleven into amir nath s gully clothe in a boorka which cloak a man a well a a woman. directly the gong in the city make the hour the little voice behind the grate take up the love song of har dyal at the verse where the panthan girl call upon har dyal to return. the song be really pretty in the vernacular. in english you miss the wail of it. it run something like this. 
alone upon the housetop to the north i turn and watch the lightning in the sky the glamour of thy footstep in the north come back to me beloved or i die. 
below my foot the still bazar be lay far far below the weary camel lie the camel and the captive of thy raid come back to me beloved or i die. 
my father s wife be old and harsh with year and drudge of all my father s house be i. my bread be sorrow and my drink be tear come back to me beloved or i die. 
a the song stop trejago step up under the grate and whisper. i be here. 
bisesa be good to look upon. 
that night be the begin of many strange thing and of a double life so wild that trejago today sometimes wonder if it be not all a dream. bisesa or her old handmaiden who have throw the object letter have detach the heavy grate from the brick work of the wall. so that the window slide inside leave only a square of raw masonry into which an active man might climb. 
in the day time trejago drive through his routine of office work or put on his call clothe and call on the lady of the station. wonder how long they would know him if they know of poor little bisesa. at night when all the city be still come the walk under the evil smell boorka the patrol through jitha megji s bustee the quick turn into amir nath s gully between the sleep cattle and the dead wall and then last of all bisesa and the deep even breathe of the old woman who sleep outside the door of the bare little room that durga charan allot to his sister s daughter. who or what durga charan be trejago never inquire. and why in the world he be not discover and knife never occur to him till his madness be over and bisesa. but this come late. 
bisesa be an endless delight to trejago. she be a ignorant a a bird. and her distort version of the rumor from the outside world that have reach her in her room amuse trejago almost a much a her lisp attempt to pronounce his name christopher. the first syllable be always more than she could manage and she make funny little gesture with her rise leaf hand a one throw the name away and then kneel before trejago ask him exactly a an englishwoman would do if he be sure he love her. trejago swear that he love her more than any one else in the world. which be true. 
after a month of this folly the exigency of his other life compel trejago to be especially attentive to a lady of his acquaintance. you may take it for a fact that anything of this kind be not only notice and discuss by a man s own race but by some hundred and fifty native a well. trejago have to walk with this lady and talk to her at the band stand and once or twice to drive with her. never for an instant dream that this would affect his dear out of the way life. but the news fly in the usual mysterious fashion from mouth to mouth till bisesa s duenna hear of it and tell bisesa. the child be so trouble that she do the household work evilly and be beat by durga charan s wife in consequence. 
a week late bisesa tax trejago with the flirtation. she understand no gradation and speak openly. trejago laugh and bisesa stamp her little foot little foot light a marigold flower that could lie in the palm of a man s one hand. 
much that be write about oriental passion and impulsiveness be exaggerate and compile at second hand but a little of it be true. and when an englishman find that little it be quite a startle a any passion in his own proper life. bisesa rag and storm and finally threaten to kill herself if trejago do not at once drop the alien memsahib who have come between them. trejago try to explain and to show her that she do not understand these thing from a western standpoint. bisesa draw herself up and say simply. 
i do not. i know only this it be not good that i should have make you dear than my own heart to me sahib. you be an englishman. 
i be only a black girl she be fair than bar gold in the mint and the widow of a black man. 
then she sob and say. but on my soul and my mother s soul i love you. there shall no harm come to you whatever happen to me. 
trejago argue with the child and try to soothe her but she seem quite unreasonably disturb. nothing would satisfy her save that all relation between them should end. he be to go away at once. and he go. a he drop out at the window she kiss his forehead twice and he walk away wonder. 
a week and then three week pass without a sign from bisesa. 
trejago think that the rupture have last quite long enough go down to amir nath s gully for the fifth time in the three week hop that his rap at the sill of the shift grate would be answer. he be not disappoint. 
there be a young moon and one stream of light fell down into amir nath s gully and strike the grate which be draw away a he knock. from the black dark bisesa hold out her arm into the moonlight. both hand have be cut off at the wrist and the stump be nearly heal. 
then a bisesa bow her head between her arm and sob some one in the room grunt like a wild beast and something sharp knife sword or spear thrust at trejago in his boorka. the stroke miss his body but cut into one of the muscle of the groin and he limp slightly from the wind for the rest of his day. 
the grate go into it place. there be no sign whatever from inside the house nothing but the moonlight strip on the high wall and the blackness of amir nath s gully behind. 
the next thing trejago remember after rag and shout like a madman between those pitiless wall be that he find himself near the river a the dawn be break throw away his boorka and go home bareheaded. 
what the tragedy be whether bisesa have in a fit of causeless despair tell everything or the intrigue have be discover and she torture to tell whether durga charan know his name and what become of bisesa trejago doe not know to this day. something horrible have happen and the think of what it must have be come upon trejago in the night now and again and keep him company till the morning. one special feature of the case be that he doe not know where lie the front of durga charan s house. it may open on to a courtyard common to two or more house or it may lie behind any one of the gate of jitha megji s bustee. trejago cannot tell. 
he cannot get bisesa poor little bisesa back again. he ha lose her in the city where each man s house be a guard and a unknowable a the grave. and the grate that open into amir nath s gully ha be wall up. 
but trejago pay his call regularly and be reckon a very decent sort of man. 
there be nothing peculiar about him except a slight stiffness cause by a rid strain in the right leg. 
in error. 
they burn a corpse upon the sand the light shine out afar. it guide home the plunge boat that beat from zanzibar. 
spirit of fire where er thy altar rise. thou art light of guidance to our eye. salsette boat song. 
there be hope for a man who get publicly and riotously drink more often that he ought to do. but there be no hope for the man who drink secretly and alone in his own house the man who be never see to drink. 
this be a rule. so there must be an exception to prove it. 
moriarty s case be that exception. 
he be a civil engineer and the government very kindly put him quite by himself in an out district with nobody but native to talk to and a great deal of work to do. he do his work well in the four year he be utterly alone. but he pick up the vice of secret and solitary drink and come up out of the wilderness more old and wear and haggard than the dead alive life have any right to make him. 
you know the say that a man who ha be alone in the jungle for more than a year be never quite sane all his life after. people credit moriarty s queerness of manner and moody way to the solitude and say it show how government spoil the future of it best men. moriarty have build himself the plinth of a very god reputation in the bridge dam girder line. but he know every night of the week that he be take step to undermine that reputation with l. l. l. and christopher and little nip of liqueur and filth of that kind. he have a sound constitution and a great brain or else he would have break down and die like a sick camel in the district a good men have do before him. 
government order him to simla after he have come out of the desert. and he go up mean to try for a post then vacant. that season mr. reiver perhaps you will remember her be in the height of her power and many men lay under her yoke. everything bad that could be say ha already be say about mr. reiver in another tale. 
moriarty be heavily build and handsome very quiet and nervously anxious to please his neighbor when he wasn t sink in a brown study. he start a good deal at sudden noise or if speak to without warn. and when you watch him drink his glass of water at dinner you could see the hand shake a little. but all this be put down to nervousness and the quiet steady sip sip sip fill and sip sip sip again that go on in his own room when he be by himself be never know. which be miraculous see how everything in a man s private life be public property out here. 
moriarty be draw not into mr. reiver s set because they be not his sort but into the power of mr. reiver and he fell down in front of her and make a goddess of her. this be due to his come fresh out of the jungle to a big town. he could not scale thing properly or see who be what. 
because mr. reiver be cold and hard he say she be stately and dignify. because she have no brain and could not talk cleverly he say she be reserve and shy. mr. reiver shy. because she be unworthy of honor or reverence from any one he reverence her from a distance and dower her with all the virtue in the bible and most of those in shakespeare. 
this big dark abstract man who be so nervous when a pony canter behind him use to moon in the train of mr. reiver blush with pleasure when she throw a word or two his way. his admiration be strictly platonic. even other woman saw and admit this. he do not move out in simla so he hear nothing against his idol. which be satisfactory. mr. reiver take no special notice of him beyond see that he be add to her list of admirer and go for a walk with him now and then just to show that he be her property claimable a such. moriarty must have do most of the talk for mr. reiver couldn t talk much to a man of his stamp. and the little she say could not have be profitable. what moriarty believe in a he have good reason to be mr. reiver s influence over him and in that belief set himself seriously to try to do away with the vice that only he himself know of. 
his experience while he be fight with it must have be peculiar but he never describe them. sometimes he would hold off from everything except water for a week. then on a rainy night when no one have ask him out to dinner and there be a big fire in his room and everything comfortable he would sit down and make a big night of it by add little nip to little nip plan big scheme of reformation meanwhile until he throw himself on his bed hopelessly drink. he suffer next morning. 
one night the big crash come. he be trouble in his own mind over his attempt to make himself worthy of the friendship of mr. reiver. the past ten day have be very bad one and the end of it all be that he receive the arrears of two and three quarter year of sip in one attack of delirium tremens of the subdue kind. begin with suicidal depression go on to fit and start and hysteria and end with downright rave. a he sit in a chair in front of the fire or walk up and down the room pick a handkerchief to piece you hear what poor moriarty really think of mr. reiver for he rave about her and his own fall for the most part. though he ravel some p. w. d. account into the same skein of think. he talk and talk and talk in a low dry whisper to himself and there be no stop him. he seem to know that there be something wrong and twice try to pull himself together and confer rationally with the doctor. but his mind run out of control at once and he fell back to a whisper and the story of his trouble. it be terrible to hear a big man babble like a child of all that a man usually lock up and put away in the deep of his heart. moriarty read out his very soul for the benefit of any one who be in the room between ten thirty that night and two forty five next morning. 
from what he say one gather how immense an influence mr. reiver hold over him and how thoroughly he felt for his own lapse. his whispering cannot of course be put down here. but they be very instructive a show the error of his estimate. 
when the trouble be over and his few acquaintance be pity him for the bad attack of jungle fever that have so pull him down moriarty swear a big oath to himself and go abroad again with mr. reiver till the end of the season adore her in a quiet and deferential way a an angel from heaven. late on he take to rid not hack but honest rid which be good proof that he be improve and you could slam door behind him without his jump to his foot with a gasp. that again be hopeful. 
how he keep his oath and what it cost him in the begin nobody know. he certainly manage to compass the hard thing that a man who ha drink heavily can do. he take his peg and wine at dinner but he never drink alone and never let what he drink have the least hold on him. 
once he tell a bosom friend the story of his great trouble and how the influence of a pure honest woman and an angel a well have save him. when the man startle at anything good be lay to mr. reiver s door laugh it cost him moriarty s friendship. 
moriarty who be marry now to a woman ten thousand time good than mr. reiver a woman who belief that there be no man on earth a good and clever a her husband will go down to his grave vow and protest that mr. reiver save him from ruin in both world. 
that she know anything of moriarty s weakness nobody believe for a moment. that she would have cut him dead throw him over and acquaint all her friend with her discovery if she have know of it nobody who know her doubt for an instant. 
moriarty think her something she never be and in that belief save himself. which be just a good a though she have be everything that he have imagine. 
but the question be what claim will mr. reiver have to the credit of moriarty s salvation when her day of reckon come. 
a bank fraud. 
he drink strong water and his speech be coarse. he purchase raiment and forebore to pay. he strike a trust junior with a horse and win gymkhana in a doubtful way. 
then twixt a vice and folly turn aside to do good deed and straight to cloak them lie. the mess room. 
if reggie burke be in india now he would resent this tale be tell. but a he be in hong kong and win t see it the tell be safe. he be the man who work the big fraud on the sind and sialkote bank. he be manager of an up country branch and a sound practical man with a large experience of native loan and insurance work. he could combine the frivolity of ordinary life with his work and yet do well. reggie burke ride anything that would let him get up dance a neatly a he ride and be want for every sort of amusement in the station. 
a he say himself and a many men find out rather to their surprise there be two burke both very much at your service. 
reggie burke between four and ten ready for anything from a hot weather gymkhana to a rid picnic. and between ten and four mr. reginald burke manager of the sind and sialkote branch bank. you might play polo with him one afternoon and hear him express his opinion when a man cross. and you might call on him next morning to raise a two thousand rupee loan on a five hundred pound insurance policy eighty pound pay in premium. he would recognize you but you would have some trouble in recognize him. 
the director of the bank it have it headquarter in calcutta and it general manager s word carry weight with the government pick their men well. they have test reggie up to a fairly severe break strain. they trust him just a much a director ever trust manager. you must see for yourself whether their trust be misplace. 
reggie s branch be in a big station and work with the usual staff one manager one accountant both english a cashier and a horde of native clerk. besides the police patrol at night outside. 
the bulk of it work for it be in a thrive district be hoondi and accommodation of all kind. a fool ha no grip of this sort of business. and a clever man who doe not go about among his client and know more than a little of their affair be bad than a fool. 
reggie be young look clean shave with a twinkle in his eye and a head that nothing short of a gallon of the gunner madeira could make any impression on. 
one day at a big dinner he announce casually that the director have shift on to him a natural curiosity from england in the accountant line. he be perfectly correct. mr. silas riley accountant be a most curious animal a long gawky rawboned yorkshireman full of the savage self conceit that blossom only in the best county in england. arrogance be a mild word for the mental attitude of mr. s. riley. he have work himself up after seven year to a cashier s position in a huddersfield bank. and all his experience lay among the factory of the north. perhaps he would have do good on the bombay side where they be happy with one half per cent. profit and money be cheap. he be useless for upper india and a wheat province where a man want a large head and a touch of imagination if he be to turn out a satisfactory balance sheet. 
he be wonderfully narrow mind in business and be new to the country have no notion that indian bank be totally distinct from home work. like most clever self make men he have much simplicity in his nature. and somehow or other have construe the ordinarily polite term of his letter of engagement into a belief that the director have choose him on account of his special and brilliant talent and that they set great store by him. this notion grow and crystallize. thus add to his natural north country conceit. 
further he be delicate suffer from some trouble in his chest and be short in his temper. 
you will admit that reggie have reason to call his new accountant a natural curiosity. the two men fail to hit it off at all. riley consider reggie a wild feather head idiot give to heaven only know what dissipation in low place call mess and totally unfit for the serious and solemn vocation of bank. he could never get over reggie s look of youth and you be damn air. and he couldn t understand reggie s friend clean build careless men in the army who ride over to big sunday breakfast at the bank and tell sultry story till riley get up and leave the room. riley be always show reggie how the business ought to be conduct and reggie have more than once to remind him that seven year limit experience between huddersfield and beverly do not qualify a man to steer a big up country business. then riley sulk and refer to himself a a pillar of the bank and a cherish friend of the director and reggie tear his hair. if a man s english subordinate fail him in this country he come to a hard time indeed for native help ha strict limitation. in the winter riley go sick for week at a time with his lung complaint and this throw more work on reggie. but he prefer it to the everlasting friction when riley be well. 
one of the travel inspector of the bank discover these collapse and report them to the director. now riley have be foist on the bank by an m. p. who want the support of riley s father who again be anxious to get his son out to a warm climate because of those lung. the m. p. have an interest in the bank. but one of the director want to advance a nominee of his own. and after riley s father have die he make the rest of the board see that an accountant who be sick for half the year have good give place to a healthy man. if riley have know the real story of his appointment he might have behave good. but know nothing his stretch of sickness alternate with restless persistent meddle irritation of reggie and all the hundred way in which conceit in a subordinate situation can find play. reggie use to call him strike and hair curl name behind his back a a relief to his own feeling. but he never abuse him to his face because he say. riley be such a frail beast that half of his loathsome conceit be due to pain in the chest. 
late one april riley go very sick indeed. the doctor punch him and thump him and tell him he would be good before long. then the doctor go to reggie and say. do you know how sick your accountant be. no. say reggie the bad the good confound him. he s a clack nuisance when he s well. i ll let you take away the bank safe if you can drug him silent for this hot weather. 
but the doctor do not laugh man i m not joke he say. i ll give him another three month in his bed and a week or so more to die in. on my honor and reputation that s all the grace he ha in this world. consumption ha hold of him to the marrow. 
reggie s face change at once into the face of mr. reginald burke and he answer. what can i do. 
nothing say the doctor. for all practical purpose the man be dead already. keep him quiet and cheerful and tell him he s go to recover. that s all. i ll look after him to the end of course. 
the doctor go away and reggie sit down to open the even mail. 
his first letter be one from the director intimate for his information that mr. riley be to resign under a month s notice by the term of his agreement tell reggie that their letter to riley would follow and advise reggie of the come of a new accountant a man whom reggie know and like. 
reggie light a cheroot and before he have finish smoke he have sketch the outline of a fraud. he put away burke the director letter and go in to talk to riley who be a ungracious a usual and fret himself over the way the bank would run during his illness. he never think of the extra work on reggie s shoulder but solely of the damage to his own prospect of advancement. then reggie assure him that everything would be well and that he reggie would confer with riley daily on the management of the bank. riley be a little soothe but he hint in a many word that he do not think much of reggie s business capacity. 
reggie be humble. and he have letter in his desk from the director that a gilbarte or a hardie might have be proud of. 
the day pass in the big darken house and the director letter of dismissal to riley come and be put away by reggie who every even bring the book to riley s room and show him what have be go forward while riley snarl. reggie do his best to make statement please to riley but the accountant be sure that the bank be go to rack and ruin without him. in june a the lie in bed tell on his spirit he ask whether his absence have be note by the director and reggie say that they have write most sympathetic letter hop that he would be able to resume his valuable service before long. he show riley the letter. and riley say that the director ought to have write to him direct. 
a few day late reggie open riley s mail in the half light of the room and give him the sheet not the envelope of a letter to riley from the director. riley say he would thank reggie not to interfere with his private paper specially a reggie know he be too weak to open his own letter. reggie apologize. 
then riley s mood change and he lecture reggie on his evil way. his horse and his bad friend. of course lie here on my back mr. burke i can t keep you straight. but when i m well i do hope you ll pay some heed to my word. reggie who have drop polo and dinner and tennis and all to attend to riley say that he be penitent and settle riley s head on the pillow and hear him fret and contradict in hard dry hack whisper without a sign of impatience. this at the end of a heavy day s office work do double duty in the latter half of june. 
when the new accountant come reggie tell him the fact of the case and announce to riley that he have a guest stay with him. riley say that he might have have more consideration than to entertain his doubtful friend at such a time. reggie make carron the new accountant sleep at the club in consequence. carron s arrival take some of the heavy work off his shoulder and he have time to attend to riley s exaction to explain soothe invent and settle and resettle the poor wretch in bed and to forge complimentary letter from calcutta. at the end of the first month riley wish to send some money home to his mother. reggie send the draft. at the end of the second month riley s salary come in just the same. reggie pay it out of his own pocket. and with it write riley a beautiful letter from the director. 
riley be very ill indeed but the flame of his life burn unsteadily. now and then he would be cheerful and confident about the future sketch plan for go home and see his mother. 
reggie listen patiently when the office work be over and encourage him. 
at other time riley insist on reggie s read the bible and grim methody tract to him. out of these tract he point moral direct at his manager. but he always find time to worry reggie about the work of the bank and to show him where the weak point lay. 
this in door sick room life and constant strain wear reggie down a good deal and shake his nerve and lower his billiard play by forty point. but the business of the bank and the business of the sick room have to go on though the glass be degree in the shade. 
at the end of the third month riley be sink fast and have begin to realize that he be very sick. but the conceit that make him worry reggie keep him from believe the bad. he want some sort of mental stimulant if he be to drag on say the doctor. 
keep him interest in life if you care about his live. so riley contrary to all the law of business and the finance receive a per cent rise of salary from the director. the mental stimulant succeed beautifully. riley be happy and cheerful and a be often the case in consumption healthy in mind when the body be weak. he linger for a full month snarl and fret about the bank talk of the future hear the bible read lecture reggie on sin and wonder when he would be able to move abroad. 
but at the end of september one mercilessly hot even he rise up in his bed with a little gasp and say quickly to reggie. mr. burke i be go to die. i know it in myself. my chest be all hollow inside and there s nothing to breathe with. to the best of my knowledge i have do nowt he be return to the talk of his boyhood to lie heavy on my conscience. god be thank i have be preserve from the gross form of sin. and i counsel you mr. burke. 
here his voice die down and reggie stoop over him. 
send my salary for september to my mother. do great thing with the bank if i have be spar. mistake policy. no fault of mine. 
then he turn his face to the wall and die. 
reggie draw the sheet over it face and go out into the verandah with his last mental stimulant a letter of condolence and sympathy from the director unused in his pocket. 
if i d be only ten minute early think reggie i might have hearten him up to pull through another day. 
tod amendment. 
the world hath set it heavy yoke upon the old white beard folk who strive to please the king. 
god s mercy be upon the young god s wisdom in the baby tongue that fear not anything. the parable of chajju bhagat. 
now tod mamma be a singularly charm woman and every one in simla know tod. most men have save him from death on occasion. 
he be beyond his ayah s control altogether and perilled his life daily to find out what would happen if you pull a mountain battery mule s tail. he be an utterly fearless young pagan about six year old and the only baby who ever break the holy calm of the supreme legislative council. 
it happen this way. tod pet kid get loose and flee up the hill off the boileaugunge road tod after it until it burst into the viceregal lodge lawn then attach to peterhoff. the council be sit at the time and the window be open because it be warm. the red lancer in the porch tell tod to go away. but tod know the red lancer and most of the member of council personally. 
moreover he have firm hold of the kid s collar and be be drag all across the flower bed. give my salaam to the long councillor sahib and ask him to help me take moti back. gasp tod. the council hear the noise through the open window. and after an interval be see the shock spectacle of a legal member and a lieutenant governor help under the direct patronage of a commander in chief and a viceroy one small and very dirty boy in a sailor s suit and a tangle of brown hair to coerce a lively and rebellious kid. they head it off down the path to the mall and tod go home in triumph and tell his mamma that all the councillor sahib have be help him to catch moti. whereat his mamma smack tod for interfere with the administration of the empire. but tod meet the legal member the next day and tell him in confidence that if the legal member ever want to catch a goat he tod would give him all the help in his power. thank you tod say the legal member. 
tod be the idol of some eighty jhampanis and half a many saises. 
he salute them all a o brother. it never enter his head that any live human be could disobey his order. and he be the buff between the servant and his mamma s wrath. the work of that household turn on tod who be adore by every one from the dhoby to the dog boy. even futteh khan the villainous loafer khit from mussoorie shirk risk tod displeasure for fear his co mate should look down on him. 
so tod have honor in the land from boileaugunge to chota simla and rule justly accord to his light. of course he speak urdu but he have also master many queer side speech like the chotee bolee of the woman and hold grave converse with shopkeeper and hill cooly alike. he be precocious for his age and his mix with native have teach him some of the more bitter truth of life. the meanness and the sordidness of it. he use over his bread and milk to deliver solemn and serious aphorism translate from the vernacular into the english that make his mamma jump and vow that tod must go home next hot weather. 
just when tod be in the bloom of his power the supreme legislature be hack out a bill for the sub montane tract a revision of the then act small than the punjab land bill but affect a few hundred thousand people none the le. the legal member have build and bolster and embroider and amend that bill till it look beautiful on paper. then the council begin to settle what they call the minor detail. a if any englishman legislate for native know enough to know which be the minor and which be the major point from the native point of view of any measure. that bill be a triumph of safe guard the interest of the tenant. one clause provide that land should not be lease on long term than five year at a stretch. because if the landlord have a tenant bind down for say twenty year he would squeeze the very life out of him. the notion be to keep up a stream of independent cultivator in the sub montane tract. and ethnologically and politically the notion be correct. the only drawback be that it be altogether wrong. a native s life in india imply the life of his son. wherefore you cannot legislate for one generation at a time. you must consider the next from the native point of view. curiously enough the native now and then and in northern india more particularly hate be over protect against himself. there be a naga village once where they live on dead and bury commissariat mule. but that be another story. 
for many reason to be explain late the people concern object to the bill. the native member in council know a much about punjabi a he know about char cross. he have say in calcutta that the bill be entirely in accord with the desire of that large and important class the cultivator. and so on and so on. the legal member s knowledge of native be limit to english speak durbaris and his own red chaprassis the sub montane tract concern no one in particular the deputy commissioner be a good deal too drive to make representation and the measure be one which deal with small landholder only. nevertheless the legal member pray that it might be correct for he be a nervously conscientious man. he do not know that no man can tell what native think unless he mix with them with the varnish off. and not always then. but he do the best he know. and the measure come up to the supreme council for the final touch while tod patrol the burra simla bazar in his morning ride and play with the monkey belong to ditta mull the bunnia and listen a a child listen to all the stray talk about this new freak of the lat sahib s. 
one day there be a dinner party at the house of tod mamma and the legal member come. tod be in bed but he keep awake till he hear the burst of laughter from the men over the coffee. then he paddle out in his little red flannel dress gown and his night suit and take refuge by the side of his father know that he would not be send back. see the misery of have a family. say tod father give tod three prune some water in a glass that have be use for claret and tell him to sit still. tod suck the prune slowly know that he would have to go when they be finish and sip the pink water like a man of the world a he listen to the conversation. presently the legal member talk shop to the head of a department mention his bill by it full name the sub montane tract ryotwari revise enactment. tod catch the one native word and lift up his small voice say. oh i know all about that. ha it be murramutted yet councillor sahib. 
how much. say the legal member. 
murramutted mend. put theek you know make nice to please ditta mull. 
the legal member leave his place and move up next to tod. 
what do you know about ryotwari little man. he say. 
i m not a little man i m tod and i know all about it. ditta mull and choga lall and amir nath and oh lakh of my friend tell me about it in the bazar when i talk to them. 
oh they do do they. what do they say tod. 
tod tuck his foot under his red flannel dress gown and say. i must fink. 
the legal member wait patiently. then tod with infinite compassion. 
you don t speak my talk do you councillor sahib. 
no. i be sorry to say i do not say the legal member. 
very well say tod. i must fink in english. 
he spend a minute put his idea in order and begin very slowly translate in his mind from the vernacular to english a many anglo indian child do. you must remember that the legal member help him on by question when he halt for tod be not equal to the sustain flight of oratory that follow.

in the pride of his youth.

dicky hatt be kidnap in his early early youth neither by landlady s daughter housemaid barmaid nor cook but by a girl so nearly of his own caste that only a woman could have say she be just the least little bite in the world below it. this happen a month before he come out to india and five day after his one and twentieth birthday. the girl be nineteen six year old than dicky in the thing of this world that be to say and for the time twice a foolish a he. 
except always fall off a horse there be nothing more fatally easy than marriage before the registrar. the ceremony cost le than fifty shilling and be remarkably like walk into a pawn shop. after the declaration of residence have be put in four minute will cover the rest of the proceeding fee attestation and all. then the registrar slide the blot pad over the name and say grimly with his pen between his teeth. now you re man and wife. and the couple walk out into the street feel a if something be horribly illegal somewhere.

but the country that dicky come to be a hard land where men of twenty one be reckon very small boy indeed and life be expensive. the salary that loom so large six thousand mile away do not go far. particularly when dicky divide it by two and remit more than the fair half at to montpelier square. one hundred and thirty five rupee out of three hundred and thirty be not much to live on. but it be absurd to suppose that mr. hatt could exist forever on the pound hold back by dicky from his outfit allowance. dicky saw this and remit at once. always remember that r. be to be pay twelve month late for a first class passage out for a lady. when you add to these trifle detail the natural instinct of a boy begin a new life in a new country and long to go about and enjoy himself and the necessity for grapple with strange work which properly speak should take up a boy s undivided attention you will see that dicky start handicap. he saw it himself for a breath or two. but he do not guess the full beauty of his future. 
a the hot weather begin the shackle settle on him and eat into his flesh. first would come letter big cross seven sheet letter from his wife tell him how she long to see him and what a heaven upon earth would be their property when they meet. 
then some boy of the chummery wherein dicky lodge would pound on the door of his bare little room and tell him to come out and look at a pony the very thing to suit him. dicky could not afford pony. he have to explain this. dicky could not afford live in the chummery modest a it be. he have to explain this before he move to a single room next the office where he work all day. he keep house on a green oil cloth table cover one chair one charpoy one photograph one tooth glass very strong and thick a seven rupee eight anna filter and mess by contract at thirty seven rupee a month. which last item be extortion. he have no punkah for a punkah cost fifteen rupee a month. but he sleep on the roof of the office with all his wife s letter under his pillow. now and again he be ask out to dinner where he get both a punkah and an ice drink. but this be seldom for people object to recognize a boy who have evidently the instinct of a scotch tallow chandler and who live in such a nasty fashion. dicky could not subscribe to any amusement so he find no amusement except the pleasure of turn over his bank book and read what it say about loan on approve security. that cost nothing. he remit through a bombay bank by the way and the station know nothing of his private affair. 
every month he send home all he could possibly spare for his wife and for another reason which be expect to explain itself shortly and would require more money. 
about this time dicky be overtake with the nervous haunt fear that beset marry men when they be out of sort. he have no pension to look to. what if he should die suddenly and leave his wife unprovided for. the think use to lay hold of him in the still hot night on the roof till the shake of his heart make him think that he be go to die then and there of heart disease.

pig. 
go stalk the red deer o er the heather ride follow the fox if you can. but for pleasure and profit together allow me the hunt of man the chase of the human the search for the soul to it ruin the hunt of man. the old shikarri. 
i believe the difference begin in the matter of a horse with a twist in his temper whom pinecoffin sell to nafferton and by whom nafferton be nearly slay. there may have be other cause of offence. the horse be the official stalk horse. nafferton be very angry. but pinecoffin laugh and say that he have never guarantee the beast s manner. nafferton laugh too though he vow that he would write off his fall against pinecoffin if he wait five year. now a dalesman from beyond skipton will forgive an injury when the strid let a man live. but a south devon man be a soft a a dartmoor bog. you can see from their name that nafferton have the race advantage of pinecoffin. he be a peculiar man and his notion of humor be cruel. he teach me a new and fascinate form of shikar. he hound pinecoffin from mithankot to jagadri and from gurgaon to abbottabad up and across the punjab a large province and in place remarkably dry. he say that he have no intention of allow assistant commissioner to sell him pup in the shape of ramp scream countrybreds without make their life a burden to them. 
most assistant commissioner develop a bend for some special work after their first hot weather in the country. the boy with digestion hope to write their name large on the frontier and struggle for dreary place like bannu and kohat. the bilious one climb into the secretariat. which be very bad for the liver. 
others be bite with a mania for district work ghuznivide coin or persian poetry. while some who come of farmer stock find that the smell of the earth after the rain get into their blood and call them to develop the resource of the province. these men be enthusiast. pinecoffin belong to their class. he know a great many fact bear on the cost of bullock and temporary well and opium scraper and what happen if you burn too much rubbish on a field in the hope of enrich use up soil. all the pinecoffins come of a landholding breed and so the land only take back her own again. unfortunately most unfortunately for pinecoffin he be a civilian a well a a farmer. nafferton watch him and think about the horse. nafferton say. see me chase that boy till he drop. i say. you can t get your knife into an assistant commissioner. nafferton tell me that i do not understand the administration of the province. 
our government be rather peculiar. it gush on the agricultural and general information side and will supply a moderately respectable man with all sort of economic statistic if he speak to it prettily. for instance you be interest in gold wash in the sand of the sutlej. you pull the string and find that it wake up half a dozen department and finally communicate say with a friend of yours in the telegraph who once write some note on the custom of the gold washer when he be on construction work in their part of the empire. he may or may not be please at be order to write out everything he know for your benefit. this depend on his temperament. the big man you be the more information and the great trouble can you raise. 
nafferton be not a big man. but he have the reputation of be very earnest. an earnest man can do much with a government. there be an earnest man who once nearly wreck. but all india know that story. i be not sure what real earnestness be. a very fair imitation can be manufacture by neglect to dress decently by moon about in a dreamy misty sort of way by take office work home after stay in office till seven and by receive crowd of native gentleman on sunday. that be one sort of earnestness. 
nafferton cast about for a peg whereon to hang his earnestness and for a string that would communicate with pinecoffin. he find both. 
they be pig. nafferton become an earnest inquirer after pig. he inform the government that he have a scheme whereby a very large percentage of the british army in india could be feed at a very large save on pig. then he hint that pinecoffin might supply him with the vary information necessary to the proper inception of the scheme. so the government write on the back of the letter. instruct mr. pinecoffin to furnish mr. nafferton with any information in his power. government be very prone to write thing on the back of letter which late lead to trouble and confusion. 
nafferton have not the faint interest in pig but he know that pinecoffin would flounce into the trap. pinecoffin be delight at be consult about pig. the indian pig be not exactly an important factor in agricultural life. but nafferton explain to pinecoffin that there be room for improvement and correspond direct with that young man. 
you may think that there be not much to be evolve from pig. it all depend how you set to work. pinecoffin be a civilian and wish to do thing thoroughly begin with an essay on the primitive pig the mythology of the pig and the dravidian pig. 
nafferton file that information twenty seven foolscap sheet and want to know about the distribution of the pig in the punjab and how it stand the plain in the hot weather. from this point onwards remember that i be give you only the bare outline of the affair the guy rope a it be of the web that nafferton spin round pinecoffin. 
pinecoffin make a color pig population map and collect observation on the comparative longevity of the pig. a. in the sub montane tract of the himalaya and. b. in the rechna doab. 
nafferton file that and ask what sort of people look after pig. this start an ethnological excursus on swineherd and draw from pinecoffin long table show the proportion per thousand of the caste in the derajat. nafferton file that bundle and explain that the figure which he want refer to the ci sutlej state where he understand that pig be very fine and large and where he propose to start a piggery. by this time government have quite forget their instruction to mr. pinecoffin. 
they be like the gentleman in keats poem who turn well oil wheel to skin other people. but pinecoffin be just enter into the spirit of the pig hunt a nafferton well know he would do. he have a fair amount of work of his own to clear away. but he sit up of night reduce pig to five place of decimal for the honor of his service. he be not go to appear ignorant of so easy a subject a pig. 
then government send him on special duty to kohat to inquire into the big seven foot iron shoe spade of that district. people have be kill each other with those peaceful tool. and government wish to know whether a modify form of agricultural implement could not tentatively and a a temporary measure be introduce among the agricultural population without needlessly or unduly exasperate the exist religious sentiment of the peasantry. 
between those spade and nafferton s pig pinecoffin be rather heavily burden. 
nafferton now begin to take up. a. the food supply of the indigenous pig with a view to the improvement of it capacity a a flesh former. b. the acclimatization of the exotic pig maintain it distinctive peculiarity. pinecoffin reply exhaustively that the exotic pig would become merge in the indigenous type. and quote horse breed statistic to prove this. 
the side issue be debate at great length on pinecoffin s side till nafferton own that he have be in the wrong and move the previous question. when pinecoffin have quite write himself out about flesh former and fibrin and glucose and the nitrogenous constituent of maize and lucerne nafferton raise the question of expense. by this time pinecoffin who have be transfer from kohat have develop a pig theory of his own which he state in thirty three folio page all carefully file by nafferton. who ask for more. 
these thing take ten month and pinecoffin s interest in the potential piggery seem to die down after he have state his own view. but nafferton bombard him with letter on the imperial aspect of the scheme a tend to officialize the sale of pork and thereby calculate to give offence to the mahomedan population of upper india. he guess that pinecoffin would want some broad free hand work after his niggle stipple decimal detail. 
pinecoffin handle the late development of the case in masterly style and prove that no popular ebullition of excitement be to be apprehend. nafferton say that there be nothing like civilian insight in matter of this kind and lure him up a bye path the possible profit to accrue to the government from the sale of hog bristle. there be an extensive literature of hog bristle and the shoe brush and colorman s trade recognize more variety of bristle than you would think possible. after pinecoffin have wonder a little at nafferton s rage for information he send back a monograph fifty one page on product of the pig. this lead him under nafferton s tender handle straight to the cawnpore factory the trade in hog skin for saddle and thence to the tanner. pinecoffin write that pomegranate seed be the best cure for hog skin and suggest for the past fourteen month have weary him that nafferton should raise his pig before he tan them. 
nafferton go back to the second section of his fifth question. 
how could the exotic pig be bring to give a much pork a it do in the west and yet assume the essentially hirsute characteristic of it oriental congener. pinecoffin felt daze for he have forget what he have write sixteen month s before and fancy that he be about to reopen the entire question. he be too far involve in the hideous tangle to retreat and in a weak moment he write. consult my first letter. which relate to the dravidian pig. a a matter of fact pinecoffin have still to reach the acclimatization stage. have go off on a side issue on the merge of type. 
then nafferton really unmask his battery. he complain to the government in stately language of the paucity of help accord to me in my earnest attempt to start a potentially remunerative industry and the flippancy with which my request for information be treat by a gentleman whose pseudo scholarly attainment should at l have teach him the primary difference between the dravidian and the berkshire variety of the genus sus. if i be to understand that the letter to which he refer me contain his serious view on the acclimatization of a valuable though possibly uncleanly animal i be reluctantly compel to believe etc. etc.

the wretched pinecoffin be tell that the service be make for the country and not the country for the service and that he have good begin to supply information about pig.

i have already state that pinecoffin come of a soft stock. this last stroke frighten and shake him. he could not understand it. but he felt he have be somehow shamelessly betray by nafferton. 
he realize that he have wrap himself up in the pigskin without need and that he could not well set himself right with his government. all his acquaintance ask after his nebulous discursiveness or his blatant self sufficiency and this make him miserable.

i m afraid i ve give you a good deal of trouble haven t i. say he. 
trouble. whimper pinecoffin. i don t mind the trouble so much though that be bad enough. but what i resent be this show up in print. it will stick to me like a burr all through my service. and i do do my best for your interminable swine. it s too bad of you on my soul it be.
